com.stremebase.dal

Class Field<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stremebase.dal.Field<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The class of the values stored in this field
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultiSetField, SerializableField, SetField, StackField, TagSetField, TextField, TupleField, VarField

    public abstract class Field<T>
extends Object
    The abstract base class for fields.

    StremeBase fields in general accept following Classes: BitSet (max 60 bits), OptionalLong, OptionalDouble, Instant, LocalTime, LocalDate, and String (for representing one word/term/token)

    Moreover, SerializableField stores any serializable value and TextField stores texts consisting of many words.

    You can also easily develop new, application-specific fields.

    Author:
    olli

    • Constructor Detail

      • Field

        public Field(Table table,
             String name)
        Creates a new field for a table. Note that first field created becomes the primary field (which must contain all keys).
        Parameters:
        table - the table
        name - the name

    • Method Detail

      • addIndex

        public void addIndex(byte indexType)
        Adds an index to a field. Index allows faster querying (no nees to linearly access all keys), but as downside writes are slower and memory consumption is higher - use with care
        Parameters:
        indexType - One the relation types defined in DB

      • flush

        public void flush()
        If isModified, flushes changes to disk

      • getFreeKey

        public long getFreeKey()
        Returns the next available key

        The callee should always be the primaryField of a table

        Returns:
        the next key

      • remove

        public void remove(long key)
        Removes key and associated values
        Parameters:
        key - the key
